result.execSummary:
The defendant Ernest A Hale Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

superMiscConds.notes: Register and comply with the sex offender registry. Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment. Attend cognitive thinking therapy class.

No contact with JNW dob 08/03/1997, MDW dob 08/14/2001, and Anisha W.
Defendant is prohibited from maintaining any social media accounts. Defendant may have an email account.  Any electronic devices must be made available to agent for inspection upon demand.
AODA assessment and comply with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random drug screens at the discretion of the agent.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay DNA surcharge on both counts. Restitution set at ZERO.

supervisions.notes:
CTS 2 & 3: Defendant is
not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program. Defendant is not appropriate for
the Substance Abuse Program.
CTS 2 & 3: Court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ernest A Hale Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (51 pages) SENTENCING, commencing 09-12-2014, received and filed.
CT 3
CT 2
Branch 38 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Branch 25 agreed to hear this matter for Branch 38. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
for PSI signed and filed.

Defendant Ernest A Hale in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Ernest A Hale in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to counts 2 and 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
As to counts 1 and 4:  Upon motion of the State, Court orders counts DISMISSED and read in.  Defense is requesting a sentencing date at least 6 weeks out.  The Court will order a PSI and remand the defendant pending sentencing on  9-12-2014 at 8:15am.
Order signed and filed.
Atty Epps requests that the plea be put over to 7-18-2014 as he and ADA Williams are in a continuing trial in Branch 25.  Plea is set for 7-18-2014 at 8:15.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Ernest A Hale not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial.  Defense requests plea hearing prior to jury trial date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 38.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Ernest A Hale not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is requesting another final pretrial to discuss results with Dr. Friedman.
Matter is currently set for jury trial on 7-21-2014.  Another final pretrial is set for 7-2-2014.

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Ernest A Hale not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Epps has misplaced his file and is requesting another final pretrial next week.  Case is adjourned to 6-10-2014 at 8:15.
Motin in Limine
Defendant's Jury Instructions.
filed

Attorney Louis E Epps in court, defendant Ernest A Hale not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.  
Defense counsel is requesting that the Court allow an expert for the defense to obtain a sample of the DNA to be tested independent of the State Crime Lab to obtain results quicker.  The Court will take request under advisement at this time.

Attorney Louis E. Epps in court, defendant Ernest A Hale not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was passed to 1:30pm as Atty Epps did not appear at 8:15am
Case set for final pretrial on 6-2-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-21-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 5-7-2014.  All discovery to be turned over by 5-7-2014.
The state will provide DNA results as soon as received.
Defense requests Bail hearing on 4-15-2014.
Original Transcript (26 pages) commencing 03-20-2014 PRELIMINARY  / ARRAIGNMENT HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Ernest A Hale in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Ernest A Hale in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Danilo Cardenas-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf on the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Neeyonna W., J.N.W. (DOB:  08/03/1997) and M.D.W. (DOB:  08/14/2001) or their family / home / residence / school.

Defendant Ernest A Hale in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Ernest A Hale in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
